intro: Hindsia cucullata, commonly known as the hooded hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of branches. Hindsia cucullata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates.
